intro: Calotis kempei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Calotis kempei is a low-growing perennial that thrives in well-drained environments.
